snippet: The United Nations human rights chief Navi Pillay condemned the Nigerian law, which gives anyone entering a same-sex union 14 years in jail.
abstract: United Nations human rights chief Navi Pillay sharply condemns Nigerian law sentencing anyone who enters same-sex marriage to 14 years in prison, or 10 years for supporters of such unions; says law violates fundamental rights and risks provoking antigay violence.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations human rights chief Navi Pillay condemned the Nigerian law, which gives anyone entering a same-sex union 14 years in jail.
